title.native: 東京喰種-トーキョーグール-:re

description:
Two years have passed since the CCG’s raid on Anteiku. Although the atmosphere in Tokyo has changed drastically due to the increased influence of the CCG, ghouls continue to pose a problem as they have begun taking caution, especially the terrorist organization Aogiri Tree, who acknowledge the CCG’s growing threat to their existence.
The creation of a special team, known as the Quinx Squad, may provide the CCG with the push they need to exterminate Tokyo’s unwanted residents. As humans who have undergone surgery in order to make use of the special abilities of ghouls, they participate in operations to eradicate the dangerous creatures. The leader of this group, Haise Sasaki, is a half-ghoul, half-human who has been trained by famed special class investigator, Kishou Arima. However, there’s more to this young man than meets the eye, as unknown memories claw at his mind, slowly reminding him of the person he used to be.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Femdom
tags.description: Female Dominance. Features sexual acts with a woman in a dominant position.

tags.name: Bondage
tags.description: Features BDSM, with or without the use of accessories.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

name.native: カナエ＝フォン・ロゼヴァルト

node.description:
[Main Twitter](https://twitter.com/sotonami) | [Secondary Twitter](https://twitter.com/sotonamix) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCefY-So0u9tiqwCL1Xw3zvA/) | [Tumblr](https://sui-zakki.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/ishida_____sui/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/ishida_sui/) | [Tumblr](https://sui-zakki.tumblr.com/)

Sui Ishida, alternatively known as Sotonami, is a Japanese manga artist. He is best known for his dark fantasy series Tokyo Ghoul, a story about a young man named Ken Kaneki who gets transformed into a ghoul after encountering one. Additionally, he is the character designer and scenario writer for the Switch game Jack Jeanne.
__Hometown:__ Hokkaido, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_7265687568142)

Freelancer with a desk at [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/). Nakajima is strongly associated with the animated adaptations of the works of [Rumiko Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/96891/), having worked as an animation director on [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/), [Maison Ikkoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1453/) and [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) also also serving as the character designer on latter.

She is married to [Tomohiro Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/122071/).

__[Website](http://coshunie.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/co_shu_nie)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/C%C3%B6-shu-Nie-%E3%82%B3%E3%82%B7%E3%83%A5%E3%83%8B%E3%82%A8-151218092226983/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/coshunie_official/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWIfHAlwe1kELZDqUmD8oRg)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0LlH6J1tj2TPq7AlwXAkY5)__ | __[Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/jp/artist/c%C3%B6-shu-nie/573663755)__

__Formed:__ 2011, Osaka Prefecture
__Genres:__ Rock (Indie Rock, Pop Rock)

__Biography:__
Co shu Nie (stylized as Cö shu Nie) is a Japanese two-member rock band under record label Sony Music Associated Records that debuted on June 6, 2018 with the single titled "[asphyxia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZB9UvUJL_lE)". Their single was used as the opening theme in the third season of [Tokyo Ghoul:re](https://anilist.co/anime/100240/Tokyo-Ghoulre). 

Prior to their debut, however, the band initially independently released their first mini album titled _Hydra_ all the way back in 2013, and according to their vocalist Miku Nakamura, the band name "Cö shu Nie" has no literal meaning, but they instead "became the meaning of the word".

__Members:__
- [Miku Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/162259) (中村未来) - vocalist, guitarist, keyboardist, manipulator (2011–)
- Shunsuke Matsumoto (松本駿介) - bass guitarist (2011–)


__Former Members:__
- Kojiro Yamazakoo (ヤマザキコウジロウ) - drummer (2011–2017)
- Ryosuke Fujita (藤田亮介) - drummer (2018–2021)

(Source: [Wikipedia (Cö shu Nie)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%C3%B6_shu_Nie), edited)

__Genre:__ Fashion punk __[Website](https://www.ziyoou-vachi.com/index.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/qb_announce)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6whFEcaV75AmQMiwlfaxvc)__ __Introduction:__ Ziyoou-vachi, otherwise internationally known as Queen Bee (stylized as QUEEN BEE) is a Japanese four-piece band under record labels Ziyoou Record (2011-) and Sony Music Associated Records (2011-). The band first made headlines when they were chosen to play on the extremely selective "ROOKIE A GO-GO" stage at Japan's largest outdoor music festival, FUJI ROCK FESTIVAL. Singing in both low and high pitch, the extremely unique main vocal along with the band’s creative and eccentric performance made them the talk of the music scene before they were even debuted. __Biography:__ The band signed with the major record label, Sony Music Associated Records in 2011 by releasing their first debut album “Peacock.” They successfully drew attention to the music industry when their song “DESCO” was used as the theme song for “Moteki”, a highly rated movie in Japan. The band was also cast in the movie and had made their first appearance on the big screen. In 2012, the band released their 2nd album “Snake Princess.” Since then they have become active regulars at Japan’s major festivals, including repeated appearances at FUJI ROCK FESTIVAL, Summer Sonic and many more. In 2013 the band went into a brief hiatus due to the departure of the guitarist because of health issue. The band came back in 2014 and released a full new album “Kirei.” In 2016, main vocal AVU started a side project Gokumontoikka and released a smash hit split single “Kinsei/Shibou Yugi." Summer of 2016, the band performed overseas for the first time at “World Music Day” Festival in Paris. After releasing their 5th album “Q” in April 2017, the band kicked off to a sold-out national tour that included 15 shows. Later that year, the band performed in the musical production of “ROCKY HORROR SHOW (Jap ver.)” featuring AVU as one of the main cast. In 2018, QUEEN BEE released a new single “HALF” which is the theme song of the highly anticipated anime “Tokyo Ghoul：re“ that was premiered in Spring 2018. In 2019, they released a new single “Fire” which is the theme song for the anime “Dororo” (created by Osamu Tezuka) that was premiered in January 2019. In March, the band made their first appearance at one of the most famous music festival in Taiwan, “MEGAPORT FESTVIAL 2019.” It was full house despite their first performance in Taiwan. In May, the band released a brand new full album “Ten.” The lead track of the album “Holy war” is the theme song for the move “Sadako,” and “Introduction” is the theme song for the live-action movie "Tokyo Ghoul【S】." Celebrating the band’s 10 year anniversary, QUEEN BEE will be kicking off a national tour with approximately 20,000 fans. In August, main vocal AVU was cast in the Japanese Broadway Musical “HEDWIG AND THE ANGRY INCH” as Yitzhak. __Members:__ - [Avu-chan](https://anilist.co/staff/124946/Avuchan) (otherwise known under her full pseudonym as Avu Barazono) - lead vocalist (2009-) - Yashi-chan (otherwise known under the full pseudonym as Yashi Akatorii) - bass guitarist (2009-) - Ruri-chan (otherwise known under the full pseudonym as Ruri Nijigamine) - drummer (2009-2023) - Hibari-kun - lead guitarist (2015-) __Former Members:__ - Yuuki-chan - lead guitarist (2009) - Gigi-chan (otherwise known under the full pseudonym Gigi Yurijou) - lead guitarist (2009-2012) (All band members are known to use pseudonyms instead of their real names, as such not much information is known about their real identity) (Source: [Ziyoou-vachi's Official Website](https://www.ziyoou-vachi.com/about/index_e.html), edited)

__[Website](http://coshunie.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/co_shu_nie)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/C%C3%B6-shu-Nie-%E3%82%B3%E3%82%B7%E3%83%A5%E3%83%8B%E3%82%A8-151218092226983/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/coshunie_official/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWIfHAlwe1kELZDqUmD8oRg)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0LlH6J1tj2TPq7AlwXAkY5)__ | __[Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/jp/artist/c%C3%B6-shu-nie/573663755)__

__Formed:__ 2011, Osaka Prefecture
__Genres:__ Rock (Indie Rock, Pop Rock)

__Biography:__
Co shu Nie (stylized as Cö shu Nie) is a Japanese two-member rock band under record label Sony Music Associated Records that debuted on June 6, 2018 with the single titled "[asphyxia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZB9UvUJL_lE)". Their single was used as the opening theme in the third season of [Tokyo Ghoul:re](https://anilist.co/anime/100240/Tokyo-Ghoulre). 

Prior to their debut, however, the band initially independently released their first mini album titled _Hydra_ all the way back in 2013, and according to their vocalist Miku Nakamura, the band name "Cö shu Nie" has no literal meaning, but they instead "became the meaning of the word".

__Members:__
- [Miku Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/162259) (中村未来) - vocalist, guitarist, keyboardist, manipulator (2011–)
- Shunsuke Matsumoto (松本駿介) - bass guitarist (2011–)


__Former Members:__
- Kojiro Yamazakoo (ヤマザキコウジロウ) - drummer (2011–2017)
- Ryosuke Fujita (藤田亮介) - drummer (2018–2021)

(Source: [Wikipedia (Cö shu Nie)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%C3%B6_shu_Nie), edited)

__Influences:__ Disney Music, Björk, Flying Lotus, Robert Glasper

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/co_shu_mikun) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/coshumicoon/)

__Biography:__
Miku Nakamura, alternatively known by her solo stage name micoon, is a Japanese vocalist, guitarist, keyboardist, composer, arranger and member of rock band [Cö shu Nie](https://anilist.co/staff/130502). She has released one EP under her solo alias titled "FORK", which came out in 2017.

In the band Cö shu Nie, she is in-charge of doing the composition and making the lyrics of all songs, except for in the song "defectum". The arrangement on the other hand is done along with the other band members, Shunsuke and Ryosuke.

__Genre:__ Fashion punk __[Website](https://www.ziyoou-vachi.com/index.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/qb_announce)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6whFEcaV75AmQMiwlfaxvc)__ __Introduction:__ Ziyoou-vachi, otherwise internationally known as Queen Bee (stylized as QUEEN BEE) is a Japanese four-piece band under record labels Ziyoou Record (2011-) and Sony Music Associated Records (2011-). In August, main vocal AVU was cast in the Japanese Broadway Musical “HEDWIG AND THE ANGRY INCH” as Yitzhak. __Members:__ - [Avu-chan](https://anilist.co/staff/124946/Avuchan) (otherwise known under her full pseudonym as Avu Barazono) - lead vocalist (2009-) - Yashi-chan (otherwise known under the full pseudonym as Yashi Akatorii) - bass guitarist (2009-) - Ruri-chan (otherwise known under the full pseudonym as Ruri Nijigamine) - drummer (2009-2023) - Hibari-kun - lead guitarist (2015-) __Former Members:__ - Yuuki-chan - lead guitarist (2009) - Gigi-chan (otherwise known under the full pseudonym Gigi Yurijou) - lead guitarist (2009-2012) (All band members are known to use pseudonyms instead of their real names, as such not much information is known about their real identity) (Source: [Ziyoou-vachi's Official Website](https://www.ziyoou-vachi.com/about/index_e.html), edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/qb_avu)

A musician of Japanese and African-American descent, known as a vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of four-piece fashion punk band [Ziyoou-vachi](https://anilist.co/staff/135580/Ziyoouvachi). In the band Avu-chan serves as the lead singer, while also in-charge of writing the lyrics and doing the composition of their songs.

In the band Avu-chan serves as the lead singer, while also in-charge of writing the lyrics and doing the composition of their songs.

He's an Ashita no Joe ''collector'' and fan and has contributed to books, TV programs, museums and more. He is also an administrator of the fansite ''SOUL OF JOE''.

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/andrerinaldidub/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/andrerinaldidub) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/andrerinaldidub) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@andrerinaldidub) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJB9-DmISWwZaBMmDqK7i2A) | [Site Web](https://www.andrerinaldi.com)

André Augusto Rinaldi is a Brazilian actor, voice actor and dubbing director. He currently directs at Grupo Macias and at DuBrasil. He is the cousin of the voice actor [Fabricio Rinaldi](https://anilist.co/staff/209058/).
__Hometown:__ Hokkaido, Japan
__Hometown:__ Hokkaido, Japan

[Website](http://themonicarial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rialisms) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rialisms/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaY5WvG6QScTq6dlRbCbp7Q)

An American voice actress, ADR director, and script writer affiliated with Funimation and Seraphim Digital/Sentai Filmworks.

Monica's father is from Pontevedra, Galicia, Spain, and when she was young, her family would often visit there. She would translate for her younger brother some of the European Spanish-dubbed cartoons which included anime like Doraemon and Dragon Ball Z, often imitating the various characters. Monica studied ballet, tap, and jazz, but transitioned to musical theater when was 12. She studied acting through high school as well as college at the University of Houston. She's cited voice actor inspirations from The Simpsons, Family Guy, and Beavis and Butt-head. She was working on a theater show with Jason Douglas, who suggested she audition for ADV Films. Her first voice-over role was a walla in the 1999 dub of Martian Successor Nadesico.

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

Rodrigo Martim is a Brazilian actor, voice actor and dubbing director. He currently directs at the DuBrasil studio.
